loans.name: Albano

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 6 filhos todos frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Trabalha como guarda numa empresa privada, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra, blocos, e outros) para dar a continuidade a obra da sua casa.
No futuro pretende concluir a sua casa para dar mais conforto e segurança a sua família e sustentar os estudos dos seus filhos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o bem-estar da família e a formação dos seus filhos.
texts.en:
He's married and has six children, all of which attend school. He lives with his family in a house he owns and does not support anyone else.
He works as a security guard for a private company. With the current loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (cement, sand, rocks, bricks, etc.) in order to continue building his house.
In the future he plans to finish building his home so that his family can be safer and more comfortable. He also plans to support his children in their studies. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
His challenge is the well-being of his family and his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, sand, rocks, bricks, etc.) in order to continue building his house.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 15 filhos dos quais 3 ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Tem um negocio próprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (feijão, arroz, óleo, amendoim, caldo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro pretende apostar na progressão do seu negócio e um dia poder ser um grande criador de gado, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é adquirir uma viatura para auxiliar no transporte dos produtos do armazém para o seu estabelecimento.
texts.en:
He's married and has 15 children, 3 of which still attend school. He lives with his family in a house he owns and does not support anyone else.
He runs his own business selling essential goods. With the current loan he intends to purchase goods (beans, rice, olive oil, peanuts, stocks, etc.) in order to increase the quantity of his merchandise.
In the future he plans to invest in the progress of his business and to someday be able to become a great cattle farmer. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so that he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
His challenge is to purchase a vehicle to help him transport his products from the warehouse to his store.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (beans, rice, olive oil, peanuts, stocks, etc.).

loans.name: Paulina

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 1 filha de apenas 6 meses, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais uma empregada que cuida da filha e vive com ela.
Trabalha como professora e quadro do Ministério de Educação, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (vidros, portas, janelas, e outros) para dar continuidade com a obra da sua casa.
No futuro espera continuar com os estudos e formar se em economia e abrir um negocio próprio para aumentar a sua renda mensal, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é concluir a sua casa e trabalhar mais para a realização dos seus projectos.
texts.en:
She's married and has a daughter who's only six months old. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports a live-in maid who takes care of her daughter.
She works as a teacher and a staffer of the Ministry of Education. With the current loan she intends to purchase construction supplies (glass, doors, windows, etc.) in order to continue building her house.
In the future she hopes to continue her studies, get a degree in economy and start a business of her own so she can increase her monthly income. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so that she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
Her challenge is to finish building her home and to work harder in order to carry out her projects.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (glass, doors, windows, etc.).

loans.name: Justina

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 1filha que frequenta a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua filha e sustenta seus pais enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas despesas.
Trabalha como governanta, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (pedra, areia, cimento, e pagamento da mão de obra) para dar continuidade com a obra da sua casa.
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e mobilar, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é concluir a sua casa e pagar devidamente o empréstimo.
texts.en:
Justina is single and the mother of 1 daughter who currently attends School, lives in her own house with her daughter and supports her parents by sending them money to help with expenses.

She works as a housekeeper and with this loan she plans to buy construction materials (stone, sand, cement and payment of labour) to continue building her house.

In future she hopes to finish her house and furnish it. To this end she commits to duly paying off her loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to complete her house and pay off her loan.

loans.use: buy construction materials (stone, sand, cement and payment of labour) to continue building her house.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma lives in Buchanan with her husband and two children.  She is 34 years old, her husband is a contractor, and her children, who are both in school, are between the ages of 9 and 12.  Emma's education stopped in 6th grade.  For the past five years, she has been selling coal and palm oil.  She has the hope that one day she will build a warehouse where she will be able to stock more charcoal.  Emma is proud of her business, because she is able to help her family.  She requested a loan to purchase more charcoal and palm oil for her business.  Her plan for the future is to build that warehouse for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and palm oil for her business

loans.name: Vicente

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 5 filhos dos quais 3 ainda frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais 2 netas que vivem com ele. 
Trabalha como guarda numa empresa privada, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, portas, aros de janelas e outros) para dar continuidade com a obra da sua casa.
No futuro pretende apoiar os seus filhos nos estudos e incentivar a se formarem profissionalmente, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é de concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua família.
texts.en:
He's married and has five children, three of which still attend school. He lives with his family in a house he owns and also supports two granddaughters who live with him.
He works as a security guard for a private company. With the current loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (cement, doors, window frames, etc.) in order to continue building his house.
In the future he plans to support his children in their studies and to encourage them to get professional training. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
His challenge is to finish building his home so that his family can be more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, doors, window frames, etc.).

loans.name: Fatima

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 1 filho que frequenta a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 1 neta que vive com ela.
Trabalha como cabeleireira num salão de aluguer e dona do negócio, com o presente empréstimo pretende fazer a legalização do seu espaço e pagar os trabalhos topográficos da sua casa.
No futuro pretende construir o seu próprio salão e concluir a obra da sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é de conseguir fundos suficientes para construir um salão próprio.
texts.en:
She's single and has a son who attends school. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports a granddaughter who lives with her.
She works as a hairdresser in a rented salon, and she owns the business. With the current loan she intends to purchase the title to her land and to pay for topographic services done in her house.
In the future she plans to build her own salon and to finish building her house. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
Her challenge is to get enough funds to build a salon of her own.

loans.use: to purchase the title to her land and to pay for topographic services done in her house.

loans.name: Romao

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 5 filhos todos frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua mãe que vive com ele. 	
Trabalha como mecânico, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (varões de ferro, cimento, barrotes, chapas de zinco e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa.
No futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e progredir profissionalmente abrindo uma oficina própria, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de fundos de investimento suficientes para abrir a oficina.
texts.en:
He's married and has five children, all of which attend school. He lives with his family in a house he owns and also supports his mother who lives with him.
He works as a mechanic. With the current loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (iron rods, cement, beams, zinc sheets, etc.) in order to continue building his house.
In the future he plans to finish building his home and to make progress in his career by opening a shop of his own. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
His challenge is the lack of sufficient funds for investing in opening his shop.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (iron rods, cement, beams, zinc sheets, etc.).

loans.name: Tejan Forroh's Group

texts.en: These are teachers of a primary school in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. These teachers have applied for a loan of 16,100,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) from SMT/Kiva lenders. School staff from this institution, like many other school staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in a business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar (treasurer) is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf. Tejan is a head teacher at the school and leader of this group. Tejan is married to a small scale businesswoman and the couple has children attending primary and secondary schools. Tejan has been a teacher for 19 years now. He has requested this loan in order to invest in agriculture. He will use it to buy seeds such as groundnuts, rice, and pepper to plant on his farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds such as groundnuts, rice, and pepper to plant on his farm

loans.name: Mirzoali

texts.ru: Мирзоали мужчина в возрасте 60 лет.Он женат имеет несколько внуков.Около 10 лет он занимается откормом скота.В этом деле ему помогают его дети.Кроме выращивания скота он еще и мясник.У них очень много клиентов которые покупают у него мясо.У него дома имеется 2 коровы и несколько быков.Один из внуков в будущем хочет стать врачом поэтому его Мирзоали копит деньги на  образование своего внука.На полученный кредит он хочет купить  еще два быка и расширить свой бизнес.Заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en:
Mirzoali is a 60-year-old man. He is married and has several grandchildren. With help from his children, Mirzoali has been raising cattle for about 10 years. He is also a butcher and has many customers who buy meat from him. He currently keeps 2 cows and several bulls.

One of Mirzoali's grandchildren wants to become a doctor, and Mirzoali is saving money for his education. Using this loan, he would like to buy two more bulls and expand his business. Mirzoali thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase two bulls

loans.name: Mamavi

texts.fr:
Mamavi est une femme âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée à un tailleur. Elle a 4 enfants, dont 1 à l’école. Le premier a 6 ans et le dernier a1an
Mamavi travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes depuis 2008. Elle vend des pagnes pour toute la population dans l’atelier de son mari. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est une rupture prématurée de stock. 
Mamavi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes. Elle veut réinvestir dans son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Mamavi voudrait avoir une boutique de vente de pagnes au grand marché de Lomé. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mamavi is a 34 year old woman. She is married to a tailor. She has 4 children, 1 of whom attends school. The eldest is 6 and the youngest 1 year old. Mamavi has worked as a 'pagne' seller (a traditional Togolese wax-printed cloth) since 2008. She sells pagnes to a broad customer base from her husband's workshop. 
She buys her stock in Lomé. Currently, her main problem is running out of stock prematurely. Mamavi is requesting this first loan with WAGES in order to buy pagnes. She wants to invest in her business. In the coming years, Mamavi would like to have a small shop selling pagnes in the grand marché of Lomé. She says that with her profits, she intends to help her husband with the children's education.

loans.use: to buy traditional outfits

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en: Mrs. Thoa was born in 1981. Her husband and she are carpenters. The couple earns  7,000,000 VND per month from this job. She has two children who are studying at primary school. She has participated in the loan program of SEDA since 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy wood to make furniture to sell.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture for selling.

loans.name: Farogat

texts.ru: Фарогат работает в сфере торговли, она торгует на рынке конфетами, приправы, жвачками и различными сладостями.  Свою деятельность начинала с малого оборота, торговлю продолжает в течении 10 лет. Раньше в бизнесе помогал старший сын, теперь он уехал в Российскую федерацию и ей приходиться самой продолжать бизнес.К великому сожалению у Фарогат несколько лет назад скончался муж, но она старается не думать о плохом, потому что рядом с ней дети и ее любящие внуки. Настоящий кредит получает что бы расширить свой товарооборот, она планирует добавить в  ассортимент соки и разные прохладительные напитки.
texts.en:
Farogat works in trade - she sells candy, various sweets, chewing gum and spices at the local market. She started with a very small operation and has kept it running for the past 10 years. Previously, Farogat received help from her eldest son, but he has since moved away to Russia and now Farogat runs her business alone. Sadly, Farogat's husband passed away several years ago, but she keeps in good spirits because she is surrounded by her loving children and grandchildren.

Farogat is taking this loan to increase her sales volume. She is planning to expand the assortment of her merchandise by stocking juices and various cold drinks.

loans.use: to expand the range of merchandise in her shop

loans.name: Vusala

texts.en:
Vusala is a 27 year-old woman who is married with three children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives with her family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.   She breeds sheep and sells them for meat purposes to local butchers and as fur. 

Vusala has more than five years of experience in this field, thanks to her father who taught her the best way to look after sheep. Her husband works as a builder and receives 80 AZN salary which is too low to support the family.

Vusala usually buys lambs which she raises and fattens for 4-5 months.  She then resells them for a profit in the local livestock bazaar.  People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always use yogurt sauce. Her monthly income is 100 AZN.   

This is main financial income in her family and not enough to cover basic needs of her beloved children. Vusala applied for a loan of 1200 AZN in order to purchase 10 sheep and fodder. This will be her third loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy ten sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Kurbangul

texts.ru: Курбангуль молодая женщина в возрасте 40 лет.Она была замужем но к большому сожалению она развелась с мужем.У нее есть одна дочь.Ее приходиться одной воспитывать дочь.Она работает педагогом в танцевальной школе.Ее заработная плата уходит только на семейные нужды.У нее очень плохие бытовые условия,квартира в которой они живут вместе с дочкой нуждается в обновлении поэтому она обратилась а нашу организацию.Курбангуль в этом году решила сделать ремонт в своей квартире,и создать комфорт себе и своей дочке.Она заранее благодарна за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Kurbangul is a young woman of 40.  She was married but, to her great regret, they divorced.  She has one daughter and she must raise her alone.  She works as a teacher in a dance school and her salary is only enough to cover household expenses.  

Kurbangul and her daughter live in very poor conditions and their apartment needs renovation.  Because of this, Kurbangul applied to our organization.  She has decided to do home repairs this year and to create a comfortable home for her daughter and herself.  She is grateful in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to do home repairs

loans.name: Amazing Grace Group

texts.en:
Amazing Grace is a group of 11 women between the ages of 24 and 65 years. They sell fish, tin tomatoes, slippers, maize, jeans wear, baskets, brooms, etc. They are all married with an average of four children. They operate their businesses in Accra-Teshie and buy the products from Agbogbloshie market in Accra. This is their forth loan with ID Ghana.

Akweley is fish seller. She buys the fish from Tema Habour (close to Accra, the capital town of Ghana) and sells to customers at Teshie. She hawks to customers and sells to them. 

She needs this loan to buy more fish since customer demand for fish has gone up. Her future ambition is to open and operate a small cool store at her residence through ID-Ghana's loan.

They need an amount of GHS 4,450 to be able to stock their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more fish since customer demand for fish has gone up.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.fr:
Emmanuel est un homme âgé de 49 ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse. Il a 5 enfants qui vont à l’école. Le premier a 19 ans et le dernier a 11 ans.  
Emmanuel travaille comme revendeur de chaussures et de sacs depuis 2000. Il vend des paires de chaussures et des sacs pour tous clients au marché. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la mévente. 
Emmanuel a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des paires de chaussures et des sacs. Il prévoit d’acheter des chaussures dames et des sacs supplémentaires avec les profits perçus. 
Dans les prochaines années, Emmanuel voudrait devenir grossiste. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit d’assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants et leur épanouissement.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 49 year old man. He is married to a retailer. He has 5 children, who attend school. The eldest is 19 and the youngest 11 years old. Emmanuel has worked as a shoe and bag trader since 2000. He sells pairs of shoes and bags to a broad customer base in the market. He buys his products in Lomé. He works alone. Currently, his main problem is the financial slump.
Emmanuel is seeking his second loan with WAGES in order to buy pairs of shoes and bags. He intends to buy ladies shoes and additional bags with the profit generated. In the coming years, Emmanuel would like to become a wholesaler.
He says that he intends to ensure the children's schooling and their development with the profits.

loans.use: to buy pairs of shoes, and bags.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa is 32 years old. She has two children who are in primary school. She is a carpenter with an income of about 3,000,000 VND each month. She has participated in the crediting program of SEDA since 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 6,496,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this cycle loan, she wants to borrow 6,496,000 VND to support her business.

loans.use: to upgrade her own carpentry studio

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh was born in 1979. She has a son in secondary school and 4-year-old daughter. 

Thanh has a food stall in the market. She earns 3,500,000 VND each month.  Her husband is a cook. He earns 3,500,000 VND from his job. The family's total income is 7,000,000 VND. 

Thanh has been a member of SEDA since 2010. During the last cycle, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND. She repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND in order to buy more ingredients and enlarge her stall.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients and enlarge her stall.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан мужчина проживающий в г.Исфаре. Женат и имеет 2 детей.Хасан является единственным кормильцем в семье,он имеет собственный магазин с продовольственными товарами. Супруга Хасана не имеет высшего образования и в свободное от воспитания детей времени помогает мужу в магазине. Хасан берет кредит суммой 2000сомони на увеличения ассортимента товара.Он благодарен , что есть такая организация, благодаря которой он может улучшить условия жизненной деятельности.
texts.en:
Hasan lives in the city of Isfara. He is married and has 2 children. Hasan is the sole provider in his family and operates his own grocery store. His wife does not have post-secondary education and, when she is not busy looking after the children, helps her husband in his shop.

Hasan is taking a loan of 2000 somoni to expand the assortment of his merchandise. He is grateful for the existence of organizations whose support allows him to improve the quality of his life.

loans.use: to expand the assortment of food products in his shop

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Mrs Hong was born in 1968. She has four children. Three children are studying at high school. Their youngest daughter is just one year old.  Her husband and she have sold fruit for 10 years. They earn 7,000,000 VND per month from this fruit stall. She has taken part in the loan program of SEDA since 2007. 

Last cycle, she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to invest in their fruit stall. Then, she hopes her business can bring in enough money for her children’s education fees.

loans.use: to invest in their fruit stall.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr:
Pauline est une femme âgée de 28 ans. Elle est mariée å un transporteur d’engins lourds. Elle a 3 enfants, dont 2  à l’école. Le premier a 7 ans et le dernier a 1 mois.
Pauline travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2004. Elle tient un commerce de produits d’alimentation générale pour toute la population chez elle. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. 
Pauline a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. 
Dans les prochaines années, Pauline voudrait augmenter son stock. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Pauline is a 28-year-old woman. She is married to a man who works as a carrier of heavy equipment. She has three children, two of whom are in school. The eldest is seven years old and the youngest is one month old.

Pauline has been working as a retailer since 2004. She runs a business selling general foodstuffs for everyone who lives in her area. She purchases the goods in Lomé.

Pauline has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase general foodstuffs. In the coming years, Pauline would like to increase her stock. She says that, with the profits, she plans to pay the fees for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase general foodstuffs.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.en:
Tahmina is a 37-year-old married woman with three children. She is an IDP and lives in a Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Tahmina has been breeding cattle and cows for the last 12 years. She was a housewife, and her husband is unemployed. Her business helps to cover her family's needs. 

Tahmina usually buys small calves, raises them, fattens them for 5-6 months, and sells them at a more profitable price at a livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 180 AZN, and this business is the only source of income for her family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Tahmina also keeps cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors. 
 
She wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She applied for a 1,500 AZN loan to purchase two calves, one cow, and fodder.  This will be her fourth loan, and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: To buy two calves, one cow, and fodder

loans.name: Zarbayim

texts.en:
Zarbayim is a 22-year-old married woman with two children. She is engaged in poultry breeding and crop raising.  She has two years in both fields.  She got married very young, at 18, and it was hard to cover family needs with an unemployed husband.  Hence, she decided to start her business.  With the help of Aqroinvest, Zarbayim bought chicken. Now it brings her a stable income of 120 AZN. 

Poultry is very popular among Azerbaijani people because it is considered very healthy and dietary. Every season poultry is demanded. For instance, goose is popular in autumn and winter, turkey in autumn and spring. Chicken is popular at all time. 

She has applied for 1,500 AZN to purchase more chicken and increase her monthly turnover. This will be her second loan and she has good client history.

loans.use: to buy more chicken.

loans.name: Bahodurhon

texts.ru: Баходурон 1976 года рождения, женат имеет 3 детей. Он работает водителем маршрутного транспорта, и ежедневно с утра по раньше он развозит людей по городу. Баходурхон сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2009 года. Почти 10 лет он работает водителем, раньше он работал на легковом автомобиле такси, а теперь развозит людей на маршрутном такси.Они с женой давно мечтали купить для дома кондиционер потому что в это время года очень жарко.Они решили на полученный кредит купить кондиционер и создать в своем доме комфорт.
texts.en:
Bahodurhon was born in 1976. He is married and has 3 children. Bahodurhon works as a driver of a passenger shuttle bus and every day, starting early in the morning, drives people around town. Bahodurhon has been working with MDO Arvand, LLC since 2009. He has been a driver for almost 10 years: he drove a taxi previously, but has now switched to driving a shuttle bus.

Bahodurhon and his wife have dreamed of buying an air conditioner for a long time as summers get very hot. They decided to take out a loan to buy an air conditioner and create comfort in their home.

loans.use: to purchase an air conditioner for his home

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 46 years old, married and has three children. Only one of them still attends college. The rest have settled into marriage and live elsewhere. Jocelyn's spouse is a farmer, while she runs a small store in front of their house. She sells grocery items to the people in her village. She also raises hogs to sell as an additional source of income. From this, Jocelyn gains about 15,000 PHP each month. It goes towards meals and her child's matriculation fees. 

Jocelyn would like to increase her sales capacity, so she is borrowing a loan of 22,000 PHP to invest in her store. She will buy canned goods, soft drinks, bread, eggs and shampoo. 

Someday, with the friendly services and affordable prices she offers, Jocelyn will earn more profit and a way of improving her family's life as well.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, bread, eggs and shampoo to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maralina

texts.en:
Maralina is a hog raiser in the village where she lives with her spouse and four children. All of her children are employed, but their income is just enough for their personal needs. Maralina has been raising hogs to fatten, breed and sell to butchers for over five years. She is happy to be generating income from her small hog raising business, but still aspires to enhance it. 

Maralina is now asking for a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy feed and medicine for her hogs. This will ensure the good growth and nutrition of her hogs, allowing her to offer them at a higher price upon distribution.

Someday, with good funds, Maralina will achieve economic stability.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her hogs.

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en: Charlie, 49, is a married man with two grown children. Charlie is a very responsible father and husband. He does everything he needs to do to meet the needs of his family. Charlie is asking for a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm. He dreams that someday his farm business will expand, so he will be able to improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his business

loans.name: Delfin

texts.en: Delfin is a 44-year-old married man with two children living in a permanent house in Minallo in the province of Isabela. He has been growing and selling rice since 1991. When he started, he was producing 50 sacks of rice, but now he produces 150 sacks. He faces the challenge of high labor costs. His dream is to diversify his business by growing more crops, and to educate his children. Delfin is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and seed for his farm.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a corn grower in Dalaoig, the Philippines. He grows corn to sell and from his business, he is able to support his family's basic needs. He has been doing corn farming for over 10 years. He aspires to improve his farm so he is now asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (Php) to invest in buying fertilizers and pesticides for his crops. This will help ensure the proper growth of his crops, leading to an abundant harvest. 

He hopes to keep improving as a successful farmer and to improve his family's life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for farming

loans.name: Cherry-Ann

texts.en:
Cherry-Ann is 22 years old, married to Boyet and blessed with two young children. She is a helpful and hardworking mother. She helps her husband maintain their farming business. The couple manages a hectare plot of land, on which they plant and harvest rice. They are very thankful to their in-laws, who gave them the rice field. It serves as their primary source of income.  

Cherry-Ann is now taking out a loan of 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) in order to improve their farming output. She will buy two bags of rice seeds, fertilizers and two liters of insecticides with the money, which will help to ensure healthier crops. 

In the future, Cherry-Ann would like to keep producing abundant crops in order to boost her profits. Additional revenue will be invested in buying pigs to raise and sell as an additional source of income.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for farming

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 57-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan.  She has a grocery store and is requesting a loan of 2,000 Jordanian dinars (JOD) to purchase goods and products for her store.

Huda is looking to expand her business and improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase goods and products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is a married man. He lives in the community of Minallo in the province of Llagan. Last season, due to the natural disaster of a drought, his small plot of rice did not grow properly. This disaster made him fail to get the income he used to get and needs to get by in life. Pedro is a man who is loved and respected where he lives. He is dedicated to his work, agriculture during the season. In his free time, he works in tire repair. 

Pedro is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds to improve his crops and increase his production, in order to increase his earnings and have a better quality of life. The loan will really help Pedro in his hard work.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow crops.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en: Pedro is a responsible farmer. He began this occupation when he started his own family. He is 48 years old, married to Emelia and blessed with two children. Pedro wants to provide the necessities for his children, especially for his youngest child who is currently in school. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for his farming business. He hopes to produce better crops out of this loan, in order to protect his family from an inappropriate way of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Wajed

texts.en:
Wajed is a conservative person and is unwilling to upload her picture to the internet. The man in the photo is her husband.

Wajed is a 33-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman in Jordan. She supports one family member.

Working from her house, Wajed sells clothes and is requesting a loan of 700 JOD to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 36-year-old married woman from Irbid, Jordan, and supports two members of her family. She is looking to improve her family living conditions so she is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to do maintenance on her house.

Sahar is looking to purchase her own personal computer.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her house.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 31 years old, has one child, and has been widowed for three years now. She carries alone the burden of generating a good income from the farming business she has operated since her spouse passed away. She primarily raises crops, planting and harvesting rice to sell. Myrna also pays laborers who help her manage the farming business.

Myrna is now asking for a loan of 31,000 PHP to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and pesticides to use in farming. She hopes that this loan will be given to her as a way to maintain her farming business. 

In the future, Myrna hopes to achieve greater crop production every harvest season and to be able to save funds for the education of her child. She hopes that she will finish a degree someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and pesticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Nicasio

texts.en:
Nicasio is a farmer in Baculud. He lives with his spouse and one child. To make a living, they both engage in a farming business planting rice to sell. They have been managing a hectare plot of land for over 10 years now. Nicasio aspires to increase his crop production for additional profits. He joined ASKI field partner and is asking for a loan to improve crop nutrition through fertilizers and pesticides applied on crops. Healthier crops will lead to an abundant harvest. He is borrowing P18,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides for use in farming.

Nicasio hopes to keep growing as a successful farmer and provide a progressive life for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for use in farming

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking mother and loving spouse. She is 39 years old and married with eight children. Erlinda and her husband make sure that they can provide for the needs of their family.

Erlinda manages a general store where she sells a variety of products which are needed within her local community. She plans to have additional products to sell, which is why she is asking for a loan of PHP50,000 to buy fruit, vegetables, ingredients and fish for her general store. She hopes that her business will expand so that she can provide quality living for her family and educate her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, ingredients and fish for her general store

loans.name: Jovie Mae

texts.en:
Jovie Mae owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling rice. She has been engaged in her business for three years and earns approximately P90,000 a month. This amount was used to purchase land property as her additional source of investment and some amount was used towards her and her family's daily household needs.

Jovie Mae joined the program of ASKI, in order to access financial services to help improve her living situation and save for her future. She is a young, business-oriented woman and determined person. She has been doing all these things in order to help her parents in providing their basic necessities.

Jovie Mae is requesting a loan of P50,000 which will be used to purchase stocks of rice for her stall. This loan amount would really help her in obtaining success in life. She hopes to obtain greater profits in order for her to maintain her rice-retailing business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice for her stall

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a small farmer at San Esteban. With her spouse, she raises crops from a hectare plot of land, on which they have planted and harvested rice for over 10 years now. They usually earn about P15,000 each harvest season, twice in a year. She would like to increase her crop production so she is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for crop maintenance. This will help produce abundant crops at harvest. 

Aida is now 51 years old and has five children. Three of them have their own employment while the rest still attend school and are in need of daily allowances. 

Aida is praying for her family's good health and good crops too. She hopes that they will become successful farmers someday.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for crop maintenance

loans.name: Zelda

texts.en:
Zelda is 42 years old, married and has three children attending school. With her spouse, she works untiringly in their hectare rice field where they cultivate and plant rice to harvest. They have been in the farming business for over 10 years now. They are very glad for the business they have which supports their needs for meals and school expenses. 

Zelda is now asking for a loan of P25,000 to invest in maintaining the farming business. She will buy fertilizers, rice seeds and pay for labor costs in farming. Zelda is paying additional laborers because her and her husband are not capable of doing all the farming activities. In return, she promises to pay back her loan in full.

With good profits from the business, she will continuously send her children to school to learn for a degree and have good employment someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, rice seeds and pay for labor costs in farming

loans.name: Romie

texts.en: Romie is 47 years old and married with three school-aged children. Romie is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns PHP 30,000 per harvest. Romie is asking for a loan of PHP 27,000 to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Romie has been growing rice for almost ten years. In the future, Romie hopes that his farming business will be more progressive and support the increasing needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 32 years old, married and has two children attending school. The couple's business is raising crops: primarily planting and harvesting rice to sell. They usually sell them to traders in their village. From the farming business, they earn about P10,000 twice a year, during harvest season. This goes towards their meals, allowances and other basic kitchen needs.

Alma is now asking for P15,000 to pay for laborers, buy fertilizers and insecticides for use in farming. She hopes to keep making the business profitable and give a better life for the family.

loans.use: to pay for laborers, buy fertilizers and insecticides for use in farming.

loans.name: Rose Marilyn

texts.en: Rose Marilyn is engaged in the farming business. She plants and harvests rice for sale. Rose Marilyn is generating PHP 30,000 during harvest season. She uses her income for the education of her four school-aged children. At present, Marilyn is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her to sustain her business. In the future, Rose Marilyn hopes to start another business aside from her farming business in order to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: Romeo has been involved in business for many years. He is an experienced farmer. He is involved in growing agricultural crops. Working on land is hard labor that requires a lot of effort and funds to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds. Romeo wants to obtain this loan to plant corn crops and gather his harvest. Currently, Romeo is teaching the farming business to his sons. He knows that the land will always provide a good harvest if you work hard enough.

loans.use: to buy corn seed and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine is 40 years old and married. Geraldine is a farmer working in the Philippines. He earns PHP 25,000 per cropping season. Geraldine is asking for a loan of PHP 23,000 to purchase fertilizers and other needed materials. Geraldine has been growing rice for almost 12 years. In the future, Geraldine hopes that his farming business will be more progressive and support the increasing needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other needed materials for the farm

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Wanting to assist her husband in providing their family needs, Melanie is also doing her best managing their farming business. At the age of 47, she now has two school-aged children. Because of that, Melanie's determination to improve their living standard has increased. To have a large crop of rice, Melanie is requesting a loan of PHP 23,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. She knows that with this loan, she will have a bountiful harvest. At present, Melanie is earning PHP 25,000 per harvest. In the future, Melanie wants to double her income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa is a 59-year-old widow with three adult children. She lives in the village of Marannao, in the province of Isabela, where the major source of income in the community is raising crops. Narcisa is a very diligent and loving person. For every crop she earns P 20,000 after almost 30 years in business. Narcisa is requesting a loan of P 15,000 to buy sacks of corn seeds, fertilizer, and to pay labor fees for her farm business. Aside from farming, she is also engaged in selling bananas in the community for additional income. Narcisa hopes that some day she can provide for all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizer and pay labor fees for her farm

loans.name: Amyjoy

texts.en: Amyjoy is 28 years old, married with one infant child. She manages a store where she sells different products like snack foods, canned goods and beverages. Amyjoy is a very loving and hardworking mother. She seeks to meet all the needs of her family which is why she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000, to buy additional products that she can offer in the community. Amyjoy hopes to build their own house someday.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, spices and snack foods for her store

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en: Amelita is 53 years old and married. She has three adult-aged children. Amelita is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns PHP 7,000 per month. Amelita is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farming necessities. Amelita has been growing rice for 10 years. In the future, Amelita hopes that her farming business will become more progressive and more able to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farming necessities

loans.name: Macario

texts.en:
Macario is a farmer who is raising his family in a village. He owns and manages a rice farming business to earn a living. He is now 58 years old and has four grown-up children. He aims to improve his farming business: to increase his yields and income in order to satisfy the family's necessities and save for future emergencies. He has been a farmer for more than 30 years and usually earns a profit of P20,000. This is usually used for their food, clothing and the allowances of his grand children. 

Due to inadequate capital, he is asking for a loan of 20,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay the labor cost incurred in transplanting rice. Through this loan, he believes that he will be able to improve his farming business and increase his yields this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay the labor cost incurred in transplanting rice

loans.name: Heherson

texts.en: Heherson is a 34-year-old married man with four grown up children. A man with determination and strength to fulfill the needs of his family. He is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy tires and spare parts for his motorcycle in order to maintain his transportation business for his customers. In the future, Heherson hopes that he can buy another motorcycle to gain additional income in order to sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tires for his motorcycle vehicle

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Due to hardship of living, Josie helps her husband in managing their corn farming business to ensure a high production. They aim to increase their yields and income to satisfy their necessities and finance the education of their two children. They want their children to earn a degree so that they will be employed someday. Despite the hardship in farming, they have the determination to improve their farming business. 

Josie wants to ask for an additional capital of P20,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in corn farming. They believe that someday, they will improve their farming business as they continue to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in corn farming

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a business-minded man who dreams of expanding his business. He is engaged in the business of selling dry goods such as bags, different kinds of clothing, toys and accessories for ladies.

Joseph is a young entrepreneur, married and having one child. His main priority is to educate his only child and uplift their lifestyle out of poverty. Due to the insufficient capital he has, Joseph is asking for a loan of P40,000. This loan amount will be used to purchase stocks of dry goods such as bags, RTW's, plastic toys for kids and different kinds of accessories for women. Joseph hopes that his loan will provide him greater profits in order for him to succeed and will enable him to educate his only child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dry goods such as bags, clothing, plastic toys for kids and different kinds of accessories for his stall

loans.name: Nyassia Group

texts.fr:
CES MEMBRES FONT PARTIES DU BANC VILLAGEOIS DE NYASSIA CRÉÉ LE 01 JUIN 2011. ELLES HABITENT LE MÊME VILLAGE ET SON EN PARFAITE HARMONIE. LEUR ACTIVITÉ PRINCIPALE EST LE PETIT COMMERCE.

MADAME SUZELLE AMY QUI EST A LA DROITE DE LA PHOTO LEVANT LA MAIN ET L'EMPRUNTEUSE EN VEDETTE. ELLE EST MARIÉE ET MÈRE DE 5 ENFANTS DONT UN GARÇON DE 13 ANS ET DE 4 FILLES DE 9, 6, 3 ANS LA DERNIÈRE A 3 MOIS.

ELLE ACHETÉ SES MARCHANDISES FRUITS ET BALAIS DANS SON VILLAGE NATAL POUR LES REVENDRE DANS LES GRANDES VILLES DE LA RÉGION.

ELLE VA ACHÈTE UNE GRANDE QUANTITÉ DE FRUITS ET DE BALAIS.

SES BÉNÉFICES LUI PERMETTRONT D AIDER SON ÉPOUX DANS LA DÉPENSE QUOTIDIENNE ACHAT DE NOURRITURE.
texts.en:
The members of the Nyassia group all belong to the same banc villageois which was founded on 1 June 2011. They all live in the same village and live in perfect harmony. Their main business activity is small trade.

Madame Suzelle Amy is the featured borrower of the group. She is standing on the right of the photo with her hand raised. She is married and has 5 children including a 13 year old boy and 4 girls aged 9, 6, 3 and 3 months.

She buys her supplies of fruit and brushes in the village where she was born and resells them in the big cities of the region.

Shewould like to buy a large quantity of fruit and brushes.

Her earnings will enable her to help her husband with the daily expense of buying food.

loans.use: to buy fruit and brushes

loans.name: Mounira

texts.fr:
Mounira est une femme âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur. Elle a 3 enfants, dont 2 à l’école.
Mounira travaille comme revendeuse de céréales depuis 2001. Elle vend des céréales pour tous clients dans un marché de la place. Elle achète les produits à Lomé et vend seule.
Mounira a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin de développer son commerce de céréales. Elle veut renforcer son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Mounira voudrait renforcer davantage son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’assurer l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mounira is a 30 year old woman. She is married to a driver. She has three children, two of whom are in school.
Mounira has been working as a trader of grain since 2001. She sells grain to all types of customers in a local market. She buys her products in Lomé and sells them by herself.
Mounira is seeking her second loan from the microfinance institution WAGES in order to develop her cereal trading business. She wants to give her business activity a boost.
In the coming years, Mounira would like to further strengthen her business. She says that she will use the profits to ensure that her family flourishes.

loans.use: to buy grain

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es: Juan José de 31 años de edad, se destaca por ser un esposo muy responsable y trabajador quien vela por el bienestar de su familia, la cual está compuesta por su esposa, dos hijos menores de 3 años, quienes son la razón principal para esforzarse más día con día, así mismo vive junto a su abuela a quien le brinda toda la ayuda necesaria. Juan se dedica a transportar estudiantes desde sus hogares hasta sus centros de estudio y viceversa, así mismo durante las noches transporta personas a diferentes iglesias. Así mismo Juan posee un pequeño negocio en su casa de habitación, donde vende lubricantes, aceites y algunos accesorios para vehículos. Mientras Juan se encuentra transportando personas su esposa se dedica al negocio del hogar con lo que logran completarse y de esta forma atender ambos negocios. Juan solicita un préstamo para poder  invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de aceites y lubricantes y así también para tapizar su microbús y repararle un golpe, con esto el espera brindar un mejor servicio y mantener a sus clientes muy satisfechos de manera que siempre cuente con ellos.
texts.en:
Juan José, 31, stands out as a very responsible and hardworking husband who looks after for the well-being of his family, which consists of his wife and two children under three.  They are his main reason for working harder every day.  They all live together with his grandmother, to whom he gives all the necessary help. Juan's job is to drive students from their homes to where they study and back, and in the evenings he drives people to different churches.  Juan also has a small business in his home, selling lubricants, motor oil, and other accessories for cars.  While Juan is driving, his wife runs the home business, so that together they can take care of both businesses.

Juan is seeking a loan so that he can invest in buying a larger amount of motor oil and lubricants and also upholster his minibus and repair a clutch.  He hopes this will allow him to offer a better service and keep his customers very happy so that he can always count on them.

loans.use: to buy lubricants to increase his business's sales.

loans.name: Mercenda

texts.en: Mercenda is a woman who loves and cares for her family. She is 44 years old, married, and with four grown up children. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional products that she can offer in the community to have additional income to sustain the needs of her family. In the future, Mercenda hopes that her business will expand.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, bottles of vinegar, sugar, salt, rice and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Dénis

texts.fr:
Dénis est un homme âgé de 53 ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse de friperie. Il a 4 enfants qui vont à l’école. Le premier a 14 ans et le dernier a 4 ans.  
Dénis travaille comme revendeur de chaussures depuis 1994. Il vent des friperies et  à tous clients de sexe féminin au marché. Il achète les produits à Lomé et travaille seul. 
Dénis a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des chaussures à Hédrzanawoé. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Dénis voudrait devenir importateur de chaussures à Lomé. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit de d’assurer l’éducation de ses enfants et leur épanouissement.
texts.en:
Dénis is a 53 year old man. He is married to a trader of second-hand clothes. He has four children who are all in school. The eldest is 14 years old and the youngest is 4 years old.
Dénis has been working as a shoe trader since 1994. He sells second-hand goods to all types of female customers at the market. He buys his supplies in Lomé and works alone.
Dénis is seeking his second loan from WAGES in order to buy shoes in Hédrzanawoé. He wants to reinvest in his business.
In the coming years, Dénis would like to become a shoe importer in Lomé. He says that he will will use the profits to ensure that his children are educated and that they prosper.

loans.use: to buy bales of second-hand clothes and shoes

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en: Felicidad is 44 years old and has three grown up children. Felicidad has managed a store for 12 years. Her spouse works as overseas worker. So that they can save fast, she built the store to help her spouse to save money for their family. Felicidad wants to keep her husband forever by her side and help her to manage the store. That's why she is asking a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional products to display in their store.

loans.use: to buy boxes of candies, drinks, soap, shampoo and spices for her store.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a woman with two school-aged children, and is a loving and hardworking wife to Jimmy. Marites manages a sari-sari store (community based store) where she offers different products to the community. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy additional products that she can display in her store to gain more customers. Marites dreams of her children finishing their studies.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, cooking oil, snack foods and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Reygan

texts.en:
Due to lack of job opportunities, Reygan manages the family's farm land, planting corn and vegetables for sale. He is 28 years old and still single. He aims to increase his yields and income so that he can help his parents to finance the education of his younger brothers and sisters. He also plans to earn and save more income to start a business someday. Sometimes he experiences problems and difficulties in life but he has the determination to achieve his goals. 

He is requesting a loan of PHP 22,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in corn farming. Through his patience and hard work, he believes that he can achieve his goals in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in corn farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy timber and cutting machines.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn owns and operates a specialized store, selling a variety of different personal products within the market of Maddela Quirino. She is 44 years old, married to a nurse, and has been blessed with three children.

Evelyn is business-oriented woman, who dreams of making bigger profits in order to establish a new business which will help her in improving their financial stability. She has had this business for almost eight years and it has allowed her to help her husband to satisfy their basic needs and save for the education of her three children.

In order to attain her goal, she is requesting additional working capital of PHP 50,000 which will be used to buy stocks of personal products. She believes that her faith and dedication in running her business, will make it possible for her to put up her restaurant and achieve success in life.

loans.use: to buy stocks of personal products.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 56, married, and has four grown-up children. They live in a rural community planting and harvesting rice, vegetables and raising livestock for sale. She aims to improve their source of living to earn sufficient income to satisfy their necessities and save for their future. She has been a farmer for more than 30 years and usually earns profits of PHP 20,000 in every harvest season. 

Due to the high cost of commodities and transportation, Zenaida and her husband plan to expand their rice plantation to increase their production. She is asking for an additional capital of PHP 22,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay the labor cost incurred in planting rice. They are hoping that they will have a plentiful harvest as they continue to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay the labor cost incurred in planting rice.

loans.name: Redentor

texts.en:
"A business minded man ", Reredentor, 41, is married and has four school-aged children. He is involved in direct selling of Vita Plus products through networking. He learned the trade from his friends who were able to gain a good income. 

He wants to achieve the same, so he is asking assistance from lenders though ASKI. He is hoping for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase different Vita Plus products such as vitamins and whitening soap. He hopes that through this investment he will be able to provide for the education of his children and operate his business in a forward-looking manner.

loans.use: to purchase different Vita Plus products  such as vitamins and whitening soap.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 44 years old, and is married to Reynaldo. To make an income, Eliza is active managing their bakery business. She has been in this business for more than five years which usually earns PHP 300 daily. 

She wants to increase her sales in order to save for her children’s education. She is also aiming to satisfy her customers requests. Right now, Eliza is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy additional stocks of raw materials such as flour, sugar, oil, yeasts and other ingredients to make a delicious bread to sell. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business to make a high proceeds.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of raw materials such as flour, sugar, oil, yeasts and other ingredients to make a delicious bread to sell.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 37 years old. A married woman, she is a mother of four children and lives in Al Hashmi, Jordan.

Fatima is looking to take a loan of 350 JOD so she can improve her home living conditions by fixing and doing some maintenance on her house.

loans.use: to improve her home living conditions.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is hardworking woman who raises six hogs to be fattened and five piglets. She wake up early in the morning to feed and clean their pigpen. After which, she prepares their breakfast and takes care of the needs of her four children. She is really glad because she is able to make all those things.

Geraldine is both a father and a mother to her children because her husband is an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW). She is thankful because she has the ability to help her husband in generating income to cover all their household expenses and the school fees of her three children.

Aside from the livestock business, Geraldine is also engaged in a farming business wherein she grows banana and corn crops. So, the profits gained from her livestock is no longer enough, due to her expenses in her corn and banana farming. For this reason, she is asking for additional working capital to the amount of PHP 10,000. This loan amount will allow her to buy hog feed and vaccines to ensure proper nutrition of her raised hogs. She hopes that this loan will provide her an increased income which will serve her family.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vaccines to improve the growth of the hogs she raises.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 51 years old. A married woman, she lives in Ashrafia, Jordan and is a mother of three children.

Fatima is looking to have a loan of 800 JOD so she can buy more quantities of blankets and bed covers so her income will increase. She also hopes to work across a larger area.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and bed covers for trading purposes.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Running a retail store is the business of Jesusa. She is selling grocery items to the people in her village. She is now 43 years old and married. She had two children. She is looking to improve her sales so she is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell so she can also boost her profits. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy sardines, coffee, breads, eggs and soft drinks to sell in her store. This will increase her sales capacity. 

Jesusa hopes to keep affordable prices for her customers and good customer service. This will help improve her business too.

loans.use: to buy sardines, coffee, breads, eggs and soft drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is 34 yeas old. A married man, he is a father of six children. He lives in Ashrafia, Jordan.

Mustafa is looking to have a loan of 1,000 JOD so he can improve his home living conditions and buy a refrigerator and washing machine.

loans.use: to improve his home living conditions and buy a refrigerator and washing machine.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is 23 years old. A married woman, she lives in Al Hashmi, Jordan.

Lubna is looking to have a loan of JOD 350 so she can improve her home living conditions and make them healthier and more suitable for her and her family.

Lubna is under 30 years old, so her loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to improve her home living conditions.

loans.name: Sirin

texts.en:
Sirin is 50 years old. A married woman, she is a mother of four children and lives in Ashrafia, Jordan.

Sirin is looking to have a loan of 800 JOD so she can buy more clothes for trading purposes.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of clothes to trade.

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.en:
Buenaventura is a responsible man. He is married to Cecilia but they do not have children yet. To earn a living, he provides motorcycle transport services to the people in his village. He had been doing it for six years. He would like to ensure safe travel for all his passengers so he is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to maintain his business. He will buy tires, crude oil and gasoline to use to maintain the motorcycle.

Buenaventura would like to keep ensuring a profitable business so he can save funds to invest in a hog-raising business which will bring additional profits. This way, he will make the family economically stable.

loans.use: to buy tires, crude oil and gasoline to maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina lives in Cataggaman with her spouse. They have no children yet. They are both involved in a business to support their needs. Her spouse is a tricycle (motorcycle) driver while she raise hogs to fatten and sell. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to maintain her spouse's business. Her loan will be invested in buying tires, crude oil and gasoline for the motorcycle. It will help ensure safe travel for all his passengers, and thus will generate good income too.

She will use the additional revenue generated to sustain her hogs. Someday, she is hoping to achieve a progressive life for her family.

loans.use: to buy tires, crude oil and gasoline for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 48 years old, married, and has three children attending school. Her spouse is a carpenter. To earn income, she patiently cooks and sells hot dogs, fish balls and other dimsums to the people in her village. She is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 to improve her sales and boost her profits. She will buy more hot dogs, fish balls and pancakes to sell. 

Corazon hopes to keep making the business profitable, to acquire more profits, and to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more hot dogs, fish balls and pancakes to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena raises hogs and currently has one sow and three piglets.  She has been raising hogs for one year.  Rowena says she has used profits from her livestock business to help finance her three-hectare corn field.  She now needs more money to buy livestock feed and vaccine and has asked for a loan of P10,000 Philippine pesos.  She believes that this loan will mean a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and vaccine for a hog raising business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 41-year-old married mother of five children who lives in Ashrafia, Jordan.  She plans to use the proceeds of this 500 JOD loan to paint her home and make other repairs to her house so that it will be more comfortable and healthier for her family.

loans.use: to paint and repair her home

loans.name: Huda

texts.en: Huda is a 45-year-old married mother of one who lives in Ashrafia, Jordan.  She plans to use the proceeds of this 800 JOD loan to buy more cleaning supplies to sell.  She hopes one day she will be able to have a store of her own.

loans.use: to buy cleaning supplies to resell

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a conservative woman and she is unwilling to upload her photo to the internet, so the photo is of her husband.

Fatima is a 58-year-old mother of three children who lives in Irbid, Jordan.

She is looking to take out a loan of 500 Jordanian dinars (JOD) so she can buy more clothes for trading purpses, to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more ladies clothes to sell

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando es un agricultor  conocido por su buen trabajo y grandes ganas de salir adelante junto a su familia. Vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los oficios del hogar, y así mismo junto a sus cuatro hijos. Fernando se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijoles, negocio en el  cual trabaja desde hace más de 20 años, sus cuatro hijos le ayudan a sembrar y desgranar el maíz que posteriormente comercializan en su hogar. Para mantener su cosecha libre de plagas Fernando debe tener todos los cuidados necesarios, por lo que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar más semillas para sembrar, de manera que pueda producir mayor cantidad de granos básicos, así mismo para comprar pesticidas, los cuales le garanticen la calidad de sus productos, con lo que sus clientes estén satisfechos de tal manera que sea recomendado con otras personas más y de esta forma obtener nuevos clientes.
texts.en: Fernando is a farmer who is known for his good work and great desire to get ahead with his family. He lives with his wife, who takes care of the home, and their four children. Fernando grows corn and beans and he has been doing this work for 20 years. his 4 children help him to sow the corn and remove the grain that he will then sell from home. To keep his harvest free of pests, Fernando has to take all the necessary care. He is requesting a loan that will enable him to buy more seed to sow so that he can produce a greater quantity of grain and to buy pesticides that guarantee the quality of his produce so that his customers will be satisfied and recommend him to other people and so bring him new customers.

loans.use: to buy seed to sow

loans.name: Tukhta

texts.ru: Тухта  родилась в образованной и  интелегентной   семье. Она  долгие  годы  занимается продажей сухофруктами точнее курагой. В данный момент её муж  иммигрирует в Российской Федерации, поэтому вся тяжесть по уходу за тремя детьми и хозяйством лежит на её плечи. Купле продажей курагой она занимается уже 12 лет. Каждый год она сначала арендует  абрикосовый сад с его многочисленными деревьями.  Обсушивает и обрабатывает их вмести со своими  детьми и продаёт по высокой цене. В прошлом году, больше половины дохода она потратила на проведение  и  организацию свадеб своих детей. Сейчас она испытывает некоторые трудности в средствах. Тухта хотела бы получит займ  чтобы купить абрикосовый сад. Она нуждается  в его урожае, так как должна прокормит своих детей.
texts.en:
Tukhta was born in an educated and intellectual family. She has worked with selling dry fruits, more precisely dried apricots, for many years. Currently her husband is immigrating to the Russian Federation, and therefore the burden of caring for the three children and the family economy lies on her shoulders. 

Tukhta has already been buying and selling dried apricots for 12 years. At the start of every year she rents an apricot orchard with many trees. She dries and treats the apricots together with her children and sells them at a high price. Last year, she spent more than half of the income on conducting and organizing weddings for her children. Now she is experiencing some difficulties with funding.

Tukhta would like to receive a loan in order to buy apricot trees. She needs the harvest, as she has to feed her children.

loans.use: To buy apricot trees

loans.name: David Manuel

texts.es: David Manuel de 45 años de edad, es un señor muy trabajador y responsable con su hogar, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos. David se ha dedicado durante muchos años a la venta de minutas, la cual está hecha de hielo granizado y jarabes de sabores, este negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante y le permite contar con ganancias extras. Su actividad principal es la agricultura, David siembra maíz y frijoles, granos básicos los cuales poseen una gran demanda ya que son parte de la dieta principal de este país, por lo que él desea contar con mayor cantidad de granos básicos y de esta forma percibir mayores ganancias. Por esta razón David solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar más semillas para sembrar,  así mismo para comprar pesticidas para el cuidado de estas. El mayor deseo de David es aumentar sus ventas y de esta forma contar con una mejor vida junto a su familia donde puedan contar con todo lo necesario.
texts.en: David Manuel is 45 years old. He is a very hardworking man and responsible in the home. He lives with his wife and two children. David has spent many years  selling minutas, a refreshment made of crushed ice and flavored syrups. He has a mobile stand that he sells from and this business brings him some extra income. His many activity is farming. David sows corn and beans, basic grains that are in great demand as they are dietary staples of this country. He wants to have a greater quantity of grain so that he can make a greater profit. For this reason, David is requesting a loan so that he can buy more seed to sow and to buy pesticides to care for the plants. David's main goal is to increase his sales and in this way to offer a better life to his family and give them all that they need.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: María Leonor

texts.es: María Leonor de cincuenta y uno años de edad vive junto a su hijo quien ya le ayuda con los gastos del hogar; ella posee un empleo de ordenanza en un centro escolar cercano a la localidad donde reside y es muy rentable para suplir sus necesidades básicas, David su hijo tiene un negocio de dulces y es de gran apoyo para María; ella es una mujer entregada a su labor y  a su hogar, su tiempo libre lo aprovecha para pasar un rato agradable en su vivienda, al ser una familia humilde todavía no poseen electricidad y eso no le permite tener una calidad de vida más completa, es por esta razón que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita realizar  la instalación eléctrica  en su casa. María Leonor tiene buen record crediticio y es muy responsable tiene la certeza que podrá saldar la deuda, y a la vez darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: María Leonor is fifty one years old. She lives with her son who helps her with the household expenses. She has a job cleaning at a school near where she lives and it is profitable enough to pay her basic necessities. David, her son, has a business selling candies and he is a great help to Maria. She is a woman who is dedicated to her home. She uses her free time to spend a pleasant time in her house. Since they are a humble family, they still don't have electricity and this does not allow them to have a higher quality of life. That is why she decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to wire the house for electricty. María Leonor has a good credit history and she is very responsible. She is sure that she can pay off the loan and give her family a full life.

loans.use: to wire her house for electricity

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is 54-year-old married woman she is a mother of four children, she lives in Irbid, Jordan. 

Muna is looking to have a loan of 500 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) so she can buy more cosmetics and dresses for trading purposes. Her social level will increase.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and dresses for trading

loans.name: Nisrein

texts.en:
Nisrein is 36-year-old married woman. She is a mother of three children and lives in Al Aqaba, Jordan. 

Nisrein is looking to have a loan of 1100 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) so she can buy more wool to make shirts and scarves for trading purposes. 

Nisrein want to open a store in the future so she can cover her children's education costs.

loans.use: to buy wool to make shirts and scarves for trading purposes

loans.name: Moisés Ángel

texts.es: Moisés Ángel de cincuenta  años de edad se dedica a la reparación y elaboración de calzado, para damas caballeros y niños, en todas las tallas y al gusto del cliente, tiene varios años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite darle un alto grado de calidad a su labor, su puesto está ubicado en el mercado de la localidad donde reside, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas quedan satisfechas con la calidad, el precio y el servicio; Moisés es un hombre emprendedor con ganas de salir adelante y obtener un futuro más próspero, quiere aumentar la producción pero necesita de materia prima por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cuero, suelos, cintas, pegamento, hilos, etc. Moisés Ángel tiene una moral intachable, responsable y con buenas referencias de pago tiene seguridad que podrá pagar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Moisés Ángel is fifty five years old. He repairs and makes shoes for men, women and children, in all sizes, according to the customers' taste. He has been doing this work for several years and has valuable experience that allows him to have a high grade of quality in his labor. His business is located in the local market where he lives. He has gained many customers because people are satisfied with the quality, the price and the service. Moisés is an enterprising man who wants to get ahead and have a more prosperous future.  He wants to expand production but he needs raw materials. That is why he is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to buy leather, soles, glue, thread, etc. Moisés Ángel has impeccable morals and is a reponsible man with good financial references. He is sure that he can pay off the loan and he also has faith that he can give his family a good life.

loans.use: to buy leather, soles, straps, glue and thread.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 49-year-old married man who is a farmer. He and his wife both perform farming activities to economize their expenses in hiring more laborers to cultivate their two hectares of corn field. 

Joseph aims to increase his income, but due to another business he had, he was not able to finance his corn field. So he is requesting a loan of 30,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) allowing him to buy fertilizer and insecticide to improve his corn crop production. This loan will help him to grow a healthier crop which will allow him to offer it at a better price. 

In the future, Joseph hopes to keep producing healthy corn crops in order for him to earn greater income that will serve in providing his family's needs and educating his three children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide to improve his corn crop production

loans.name: Lama

texts.en:
Lama is a conservative woman who is unwilling to upload her photo to the Internet, so the photo is of her mother. 

Lama is a 19-year-old single woman who is responsible for three family members. She lives in Al Karak, Jordan. 

Lama is looking to have a loan of 400 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to buy more clothes for trading purposes.  Her income will increase with the sale of more clothes. 

Lama is under 30 years old so her loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for trading purposes

loans.name: Sa'dyeh

texts.en:
Sa'dyeh is a 52-year-old married woman who is a mother of three children. She lives in Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan. 

Sa'dyeh is looking to have a loan of 700 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) so she can improve her living conditions at home, buy furniture, and fix her home. It will be more beautiful, she will build more rooms for it, and make external spaces for her home.

loans.use: to improve her living conditions at home, buy furniture, and fix her home

loans.name: María Luisa
